title: [K-12] MOOC-Based Social Attitude Change Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic social phenomena and proficiency in digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Interactive classes centered on real-time discussions and case analysis, aimed at improving awareness of social issues

learning_goals: Learners achieve a 30% improvement in cognitive understanding of social issues through MOOC content and discussion activities.
Learners record affective responses related to attitude change (e.g., empathy, responsibility) with over 80% participation through weekly scenario-based activities.
Learners specify at least one actionable social behavior strategy by submitting a behavior change plan upon course completion.

resources: Digital collaboration tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Docs)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
